thread.title: Joe Landos New Book The Pond Is a Fun and Vibrant Tale for Young Readers
thread.title_full: Joe Landos New Book The Pond Is a Fun and Vibrant Tale for Young Readers - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Joe Landos New Book The Pond Is a Fun and Vibrant Tale for Young Readers
text:
Recent release “The Pond,” from Page Publishing author Joe Lando, is an imaginative story of a young boy coming to the aid of some newfound companions.
(PRWEB) October 16, 2015
Joe Lando, a retired corporate executive and educator of at-risk students, has completed his first book “The Pond”: a gripping and potent story is both entertaining and educational.
When asked to describe the book, Lando stated, “One day as I was sitting on the shore of the pond that borders our home, I gazed at all the wildlife that called the pond their home. I fantasized that I could write a story using the wildlife and perhaps include an educational component for young children that could be used in a classroom setting. As I was writing and naming the birds and animals that were going to be used in the story, I also included a little boy, Joey, my son. As the story unfolds, Joey makes up the names of the wildlife and starts talking to them. A child’s imagination can run wild, as any parent would know!”
Published by New York City-based Page Publishing, Joe Lando’s poignant tale is a splendid narrative for young readers. Lessons abound in this cheerful and inspired work, which is accompanied by beautiful illustrations created by Amy Siebers.
Talking birds, otters, and an alligator! Little Joey discovers that his pond is the neatest place to be. Every day he sits on the shore of the pond near his home. He always talks to the wildlife in make-believe. One sunny day, they start talking back! Harry the Heron, Ollie the Otter, and Little Al the alligator. Certainly they aren’t actually talkingare they? The animals tell Joey about a problem concerning Little Al and ask him to solve it.
This story is developed to allow a child to learn problem-solving and science components skills.
Readers who wish to experience this charming work can purchase “The Pond” at bookstores everywhere, or online at the Apple iTunes store, Amazon, Google Play or Barnes and Noble.
For additional information or media inquiries, contact Page Publishing at 866-315-2708.
About Page Publishing
Page Publishing is a traditional New York based full-service publishing house that handles all of the intricacies involved in publishing its authors’ books, including distribution in the world’s largest retail outlets and royalty generation. Page Publishing knows that authors need to be free to create - not bogged down with complicated business issues like eBook conversion, establishing wholesale accounts, insurance, shipping, taxes and the like. Its roster of authors can leave behind these tedious, complex and time consuming issues, and focus on their passion: writing and creating. Learn more at http://www.pagepublishing.com .
